messages.message:
hi team, I'm trying to get the SAML sandbox running on the latest master. but after deployment i have not been able to log in with the credentials on 1password. when I enter the credentials I get a blank page. I am also not seeing any errors from the Network tab, but just a warning:
```DevTools failed to load source map: Could not load content for https://saml.sandbox.instabase.com/static/output/toastr.js.map: HTTP error: status code 404, net::ERR_HTTP_RESPONSE_CODE_FAILURE```
I also did the following:
1. clearing out my cache and cookies
2. confirmed that all pods are running (https://console.cloud.google.com/kubernetes/discovery?project=instabase-dev&pageState=(%22savedViews%22:(%22i%22:%223a17cc3cf0454dce873fd25c9f079836%22,%22c%22:%5B%5D,%22n%22:%5B%22saml%22%5D)))
Has anyone had this issue before? Would appreciate any pointers :pray:
you may want to dive into the webapp logs and see if there are any errors surfacing there

I see:
```2022-09-27 15:29:09.692 PDTTraceback (most recent call last): File "/instabase-server/py/instabase/utils/web/handler_util.py", line 32, in inner_func return f(*args, **kwargs) File "/instabase-server/py/instabase/handler/sso/saml2.py", line 363, in post userSession, groups, url, is_first_time_login=False, clients=clients) File "/instabase-server/py/instabase/handler/sso/saml2.py", line 137, in _request_org_selection_or_login account_service_pb2.SAML) File "/instabase-server/py/instabase/handler/sso/saml2.py", line 42, in _update_authorized_groups_for_user authority_type=account_service_pb2.AuthorityType(authority_type), TypeError: 'EnumTypeWrapper' object is not callable```
Looks like it could be related to the thrift migration work?

Reminds me, we should probably build a manual test plan and make sure we hit some of these more obscure code paths. E.g. we should test out LDAP as well, which I think @Victor Zeng may know how to setup.
Thereâ€™s a guide for setting up ldap here: https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/CI/pages/1202978835/How+to+set+up+LDAP+integration+locally+and+in+sandboxes
@Yan Wang @Heymian i think i know the issue. will put in a fix shortly
